Photo of Mr Mamas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Denver omelet with crispy hash browns and plate sized chocolate chip pancake!

3S7_F6kwAReXeHOkJxqJKA.text: Yup, Mr. Mama's hasnal these reviews for a reason. And they live up to the hype. Ita a great beakfast place. Not only is the staff very friendly, but the food prep is excellent. They will accommodate for whatever you want.

NyQ1QJTOvCu-VQyl8S_6wQ.text: Awesome find!  Omelets are HUGE and delicious.  We had great service - expect a wait, but worth it!

0QLXpdwesV1Pc-hV815ajQ.text: Be prepared. Get a good night's rest. If at all possible, eat a really light dinner the night before you plan on going here for breakfast! You will thank me....if they sell gift cards from Mr Momma's, I will take it!  LoL! HUGE portions!  The food, the service, the staff...stellar! You have to try the pancakes! Let me go on, and on, and on. They are thick yet light and ya know how thick pancakes fall apart and become moosh as soon as the syrup hits them? Yah, these don't! They are delicious and HUGE! Also, you gotta try the sausage gravy! They make it with sausage AND bacon with a touch of maple syrup! I could actually eat cauliflower if it had that heavy on it!  Staff was amazing (Hi Kat!), I had never been there yet I felt as though we were regulars! I will definitely make a point to come back next time I'm in Vegas!

0zolysMKtkNWx_sXAAYTzQ.text: This place has great food and awesome service! From the moment my family entered the door to the time we exited, we were given great customer service with a smile.

cemM1JWo1OtRqIPJqLB8Ww.text: This is my favorite breakfast spot in Las Vegas. It's not ritzee or fancy inside, just your average breakfast spot. The service is incredibly warm, welcoming, and attentive. Sometimes it can get a little busy but I assure you it is worth the wait the food is incredible. The food is always fresh, never heavy, never greasy. But beware if you don't like your picture taken because one of the managers comes around and tries to take your picture while you're eating, obviously you can say no, but just a heads up. I recommend the breakfast burrito it is A+++!

qq9pZE4OsImQDc8Kr9Z1MA.text: Mr Mamas delivers excellent service with a knockout punch.  What really makes a difference here is their amazing customer service.  From walking in, the gentleman seating us already makes you feel as if you're one of the family.  The continued greatness is felt throughout the meal and you're walking out the door.    The meal here was good.  I had ordered the Mama's Sandwich which is loaded with turkey, bacon, avocado and pepper jack cheese.   The bread is wonderfully toasted to hold in all of the goodness. The French fries were ok but somewhat under done.  It was unfortunate.  I know I will definitely be back to try their breakfast items.    This new location is much bigger than their previous spot.  Different location but same great service.  See you again soon!

photos.caption: Photo of Mr Mamas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bacon cheeseburger
Photo of Mr Mamas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mamas Sandwich- turkey, bacon and avocado

-mX4cmOzy55DxADpSdonXA.text: This place is so personal that the owner not only comes out to converse with the customers he also helps serve and from what we were told cooks at time too. This hands on approach definately shines through and the food itself is amazing. Highly recommend.

XChmVP0rYycXUIUjZmoAvQ.text: Love the food will definitely return.. the host and the staff  was very sweet and friendly love everyone's energy..

oCZWXAehG_5fnRclAPMCOg.text: This place is incredible! Hidden in a western strip mall, the owner opens the door and personally greets everyone. The management attitude clearly carries into the staff. Fast, friendly, and good food.  It's a diner that serves an excellent breakfast and a good lunch. Standard American fare where you feel like an old friend and return customer on the first visit.  Looking forward to our return!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Mr Mamas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

RUwUgJF46x9JMeqMjea7bg.text: We're so glad we ate here while visiting Vegas. This was our favorite breakfast place, food was really, really good! Service was great too! There was a bit of a wait, but seriously, definitely worth the wait! Will definitely be back when we visit Vegas again. Thanks again for our to go's coffee Crystal!

HcsjBpdv30uIB-2YW9lqMA.text: The hype is real. I will drive the 10 miles out of my way to have breakfast here.   First off, everyone is super friendly. The owner is right there at the front door greeting customers as they walk in. He also walks around to every table to ensure everything is superb. The servers go out of their way to make you happy and always have a smile on their face.   As for the food, DELICIOUS! We have tried almost everything from the menu. Corned beef hash, French toast, breakfast wrap, burger, salad...and nothing has disappointed us. My favorite thing on their menu has to be their hash browns. I always get them well done. They are crunchy on the outside and warm and soft on the inside. So so good. Their coffee is also good and smooth. Portions and pricing are right.   Like I said, if you are looking for a solid breakfast joint with good service, this is definitely the spot.

Photo of Mr Mamas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Marty wrap
Photo of Mr Mamas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mama&#39;s sandwich with onion rings

tsxJ_9OpOqV6aHbqHY7SHQ.text: Cheap, quick, and yummy. Great for breakfast with the fam. Does tend to get very busy sunday mornings so be prepared for a wait.

QE1IZJMaWyZAhEGPJfIFBA.text: Wow!!! Super friendly folks work here!! Everyone was nice. The G-R-A-V-Y!!! It has sausage, bacon, and Maple syrup!! Next time I need to get biscuits and gravy to go!! I had the chicken fried steak and eggs! Amazing!! I drove from the other side of town and I will be back!!

photos.caption: Photo of Mr Mamas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken Fried Steak and eggs!

0O6fYwGgfV2KmWVsnHHwqw.text: Ok, nothing remarkable.  Expectations were very high from reviews but found it "just ok" & unfortunately, had to knock it down one star because I didn't feel the value (quality & quantity for the price) was there to warrant three.

TxvSJI0KyqW2Imxn8Q8tzA.text: We went here for brunch and literally got seats a few seconds after we got there. For it being on the busy side they were able to get us seated fast and not too long after we put our order in, our food came out.   We both ordered the Chicken Fried Steak and it comes with potatoes, eggs and your choice of toast. Out of all the breakfast places I've been to this had to be the best Chicken Fried Steak I've had yet and I love how the hash browns were seasoned. Both of us were completely satisfied with our meals, leaving with full and happy tummies. Only thing I wished was that they had more options on their menu but what we tried was executed perfectly.  The customer service is on point here, everyone is so nice and the environment is so welcoming. I love the staff here. We even got asked if we wanted our picture taken. Just an overall really good experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Mr Mamas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. We got asked if we wanted a picture, the staff is so friendly here.

YpZ_hnEGkOHbHwQ_ns4Uhw.text: When in Vegas this is the spot for a mom and pop kind of breakfast. Let me tell you every time we visit vegas we visit Mr. Mamas. So far everything is delicious but today I had the chicken fried steak and it was the best I've had so far. Their staff is very attentive and work like a well oiled machine. I highly recommend this spot.

s_Wfve8R2jazYDSSI6RHHA.text: Omg this place is the best brunch place , you must try the Jenna wrap with extra sour cream there orange juice is the best , this place is a must try

SHUyWyjy7U_Rpu1sg6nKGQ.text: I visited this place during my trip to Vegas.    The wait....the wait to get seated was serious. It's not close to the strip,but you can tell that the locals love this place. Usually, I stick to omelettes as, I am not much of a breakfast eater. However, the wait staff "hyped up" the Country Fried Steak and it was just gross. Maybe it's a Vegas thing but, it tasted like grounded scrapple. You know?! That southern delicacy... And I just wasn't expecting it in Las Vegas, which is definitely not the South! The only thing I enjoyed was the lemonade and the "Home Fries" which are basically diced potatoes. I opted for $2 extra to add peppers. And it was decent. I will say that the price range was very good. I just wished that the food was as well. The wait staffed on 11/21 just seemed gloomy for a Monday. Overall, I wouldn't come back. Try Cracker Barrel.

photos.caption: Photo of Mr Mamas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Country Fried Steak with a biscuit and scrambled eggs and Home Fries with peppers

ntZt0qkMOWLeXUBCu_vOXA.text: THE BEST FRENCH TOAST I HAVE EVER HAD! Wonderful staff and the kindest waiters/waitress. Food is delicious and within anyone's budget. You will enjoy yourself here.

photos.caption: Photo of Mr Mamas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Mr Mamas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

9HvzwUAPrPv9FAc4qOQcrg.text: One of the best service I got at a breakfast place! People are super friendly.   I wanted to come here for a couple of things. One is the cinnamon bun and two is for their biscuits and gravy.   Cinnamon bun came out first and it was nice and fresh from the oven. It was cover in sugary glaze sauce. YUM. I was only able to eat two or three bites and couldn't eat anymore. It was way too sweet but good.   Next, I ordered the biscuits and gravy with a side of hash browns. The biscuits were delicious. It was warm and toasty and the gravy wasn't too bad either. The biscuits are cooked in-house and you can taste the difference from the store bought ones. The hash browns are the best here. Nice and crispy in every bite. Love it.   It was a little bit off the strip but I would come back again. However, you must come early this place gets pack real fast.

photos.caption: Photo of Mr Mamas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cinnamon bun

7moH23-KKWkKvfKrSFHfOQ.text: I love this place. Good food, low price And amazing customer service every time we go

FlhCf31B1AODK_W_b-7tsA.text: For a family owned restaurant this place is amazing. From the moment we walked in Kat took great care of us. The service was AWESOME and the staff very attentive.   The food was just as amazing and cooked with love. All of us enjoyed our food from pancakes, omelette, home fried potatoes and now my fav steak and eggs. So good we came back 2 days later!!! This place is definitely a gem and will tell all my folks to patronize this awesome place when in Vegas.

ZJYAZWg3oBT6tVMp6vt5zQ.text: We stopped here for breakfast this morning after getting off the plane from Sacramento. As we drove up to the place we noticed quite a few people waiting outside so we figured it would be good. On Yelp have it 4 1/2 stars. We had the best breakfast ever. The food was fresh I had the corned beef hash with hash browns and eggs and my sister had chicken fried steak; my mother had French toast and my husband had bacon hash browns toast and eggs. Everything was so good. The service was fast and the staff were very friendly and attentive. The owner came by to see how everything was and he was really nice and friendly. I will definitely stop by again if I'm in Las Vegas. I recommend it to everyone and anyone

GfyJXGLsDddsKLPrw0HKCA.text: Listen . . . If you are looking for a great breakfast to start your day while in Las Vegas, look no more.  I instantly added them to my elite list of Top 5 favorite breakfast experiences. I'm a Midwest girl and we love our big portions. I've never had so much food before!! The pancakes are bigger than the size of my head. And . .the waitress let us substitute the toast that comes with the meal for one pancake. What??! No one has ever let me do that! No up charge I asked. . . with a smile the server answered to my surprise "no". And . . . You can order one pancake or one piece of French toast if you want.  I had chicken fried steak- bigger than my face too - with some of the best sausage gravy I have ever tasted! And that's saying a lot because my parents are from the South and I've had my share of gravy.  The food was great but so was the service! From the time we walked in the door to the steps we took leaving, the hostess and wait staff was very attentive to our every need. My husband's coffee cup was never empty, my soda was strong and always topped off.  Just simply amazing! We are big fans and will always visit Mr. Mamas for a great meal!

photos.caption: Photo of Mr Mamas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yum-Oh!!
Photo of Mr Mamas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yum-Oh!!!

NR2cxeTGWFH8j357hioDlA.text: 20 min wait on a Wednesday. Well worth it. Got the waffles and French toast. Both were awesome. Syrup was amazing.

iLF3RJxcnXtDeinftAMNOQ.text: Seems to be packed all the time especially on weekends but the food is worth waiting. Dont come here on a Sunday. It is about 45 mins wait, other rhan that, we appreciate everything from the nice and friendly staff, good food and affordability.

5UtVTLYhJcwYPNbXdhhBSA.text: Came in for breakfast,started with cinnamon rolls they were delicious their were four of us not one of us could finish our meal plenty of food,great breakfast will be back every day until we go back to Boston

oGWO3dnYNCPeoIy_Vg7gEQ.text: I had the steak and eggs and corn beef hash.  The eggs with home fries, the hash with hashbrowns because duh.  This restaurant's food was really good.  I'd never say it's the best X, Y, or Z of anything I had eaten, but it's somewhere where I would return repeatedly because the food is just solid.  Their potatoes, whether they be home fries or hashbrowns, are on point.  Damn good taters.  Awesome service and they have the restaurant running like a machine.  Also really awesome coffee to me, but I may just be used to garbage work coffee.

nREzpIAgeNFuu1otx34RaQ.text: First, Shawn opens the the door for you when you get to Mr. Mamas. Makes you feel special especially when  you're in a wheelchair like myself. We got seated immediately and of course I order my biscuits and gravy. They ARE different here because the gravy is very delicious because it has big chunks of sausage. Now mind you Shawn is always making sure you don't need anything.  Now after you're done with your coffee, biscuits and gravy,  eggs, bacon and pancakes you pay your bill which came out to $26. Pretty good deal when you and your husband eat a savory   breakfast in Vegas. Then Shawn of course bids you farewell and pleasant travels back home. We will definitely make this spot a definite stop when we're back in Vegas!!!!!! Thank you Shawn and Mr. MAMAS for a wonderful ending to my birthday weekend.

photos.caption: Photo of Mr Mamas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

x92GOY0l77HVjABlB52LIg.text: From when we walked in to leaving the restaurant, we were treated extremely special. The customer service was definitely on point and extremely friendly!   Immediately after we walked in to the restaurant we were greeted by a very happy and welcoming gentlemen who walked us to our table. He was genuinely happy and made us feel extremely welcomed and special. In a restaurant that was almost completely full he did seem rushed or frazzled which was a pleasant feeling. He introduced us to our waitress and the service was amazing from start to finish.  Food was like any other breakfast place. Nothing special or spectacular about the menu. I'm not very picky about coffee but I do like having the option of having flavored creamers (like how many other breakfast places have) and this restaurant does not offer flavored creamers. I prefer eggworks or Baby Stacks, but have to commend this place for its amazing customer service.

photos.caption: Photo of Mr Mamas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Country Friead Steak and Eggs
Photo of Mr Mamas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Mr Mamas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tuna Sandwich

Gf56F1Xn6p9dxhFtw65gZQ.text: A homerun! Great food& awesome staff. A well run establishment where the owner/management makes every customer feel appreciated and welcome.  Food Notes(because that is why you are here right?): *The corned beef hash is by far the best I have had. *Eggs done right.  *Giant delicious pancakes. *Onion rings....OMG....the onion rings!  We will be back for sure!

j7bYvoWcFeG5TGsJGuIjug.text: Amazing brunch!  From the top quality service and attitude of the wait-staff and hostess to the chef and food quality this restaurant stands as an example of a really fantastic experience. I will definitely come back here again. Loved my poached eggs Florentine with hash browns. The really lemony hollandaise sauses was perfect and I loved the perfectly grilled tomato and yummy spinach. The hash browns were crisp and delicious. They have these edges that are crisp and bring me right back to my childhood eating potato sticks--oh boy so good!!!

IZOfYKhUFF_YQ8TVdWS15g.text: Was here last week. Food was great but what made it more pleasant was the staff. Very friendly,  very helpful,  and Mr. Mama had great stories. Thank you for the wonderful experience!!

e4tcxf30sA6ELrNwA93SzA.text: Cheap, delicious, great selection, friendly staff. French toast and Greek yogurt parfait were among the good stuff I tried today. This place is outside of the main strip, but worth the small trip via Uber or Lyft to save $ and get good cheaper food !

9Duf5oGwSYfPftEP6VKNkw.text: The food is amazing and the staff is equally as amazing! My family and I love this place!

ma5dUThdp49ka95t9eZtSQ.text: Absolutely fantastic service and food, everything was very quick and on time. Very clean ecstatically Schmidt, would highly recommend visiting there restaurant.

AECyPOOx-LddUASc1iEfiQ.text: Made it back to Mr Mamas when we were in Las Vegas.  It did not disappoint.  My wife and I both had the daily special.  She had the ABC omelet with hash browns and biscuits and gravy.  I had the 3 meat omelet (sausage, bacon, and ham) with homestyle potatoes and toast.  It's was just as good as the first time.  This time Mr Mama stopped by our table and made sure everything was to our liking, which it was.  When we return to Las Vegas again we will stop in.  This has turned into our most stop place when there.

EWYUuw1TN5RnFDRxlsGJQg.text: When we walked up to Mr Mamas we felt like royalty! The owner and the other employees opened both doors for us and greeted us. Nick the owner and staff are wonderful and we didn't even eat yet! At this point my husband and i said we would come back just for the service! The french toast was amazing and my son loved the cinnamon roll! This place is a must!!!

DBj-aDPRH0M5gM7_LEcN2w.text: I'm so happy we decided to stop by and try Mr. Mamas for breakfast.  The food was delicious and i appreciated the wonderful, warm,  and friendly service! I will definitely stop by for brunch whenever I'm in the Vegas area!   PS: the onion rings are amazing!!

photos.caption: Photo of Mr Mamas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Onion rings
Photo of Mr Mamas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cali omelette

fKsIop-dq1sCtXq3FBu5Zw.text: This place is outstanding! We went back a second time it was that good. The food is incredible, the service was the best I've ever had. They took great care of us and Mr. Mama even came over to chat with us. The coffee was soooo good! We waited 30 minutes the first day and it was worth it. We got there earlier the next day and sat right down.

photos.caption: Photo of Mr Mamas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mamas French toast with blackberries and whipped cream.

_5pclDXQdrzzm7GFmldl4A.text: My wife and I have been coming here for years. The cuisine is basic comfort food done exceptionally well. For breakfast the eggs and omelettes are some of the tastiest I have ever had. For lunch the burger, gyro, and club sandwich are all in a class by themselves. The owner is outstanding and very personable and makes this dining establishment feel like you are eating at your uncle's house. Try it and you will be hooked!

Gka8HLWUM7Y-wSyOL7G1xQ.text: I really feel this is a place to come for breakfast. Although there was a 30 min. wait, it worked towards our advantage because as time passed I got hungrier.  If the food is good, the wait is worth it; this was the case for this establishment. One thing that jumped at me was that there was a good variety of people from different nationalities, so you know its a good place to eat if it is able to attract different tastes.  The food was good but the french toast was even better. The service was great, real friendly and it seemed that they really work well as a team helping each other out by serving their customers from taking orders, refilling drinks, cleaning up plates, etc. Our server, Jen I believe, was really nice and knowledgeable about the food they serve, which was helpful when making a decision to order. The place is clean and I was surprised that the syrup container was not sticky at all, it was fairly clean. I feel the price I paid was worth it and if and when I come back to Vegas, I will most definitely come back to Mr. Mammas, regardless if my hotel serves breakfast.

photos.caption: Photo of Mr Mamas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. chicken fried steak meal
Photo of Mr Mamas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. the syrup container is fairly clean
Photo of Mr Mamas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. french toast (1)

1Ua0a51mFIL6PR0yNuJpGw.text: I love this place for breakfast when I'm in Vegas. It's nice that it's a couple miles off the strip so parking is easy and not so crowded. They have great food and great service. The servers, hostesses and managers are all very hard working and make it a nice environment to enjoy breakfast. The wait can be pretty long on weekend mornings but weekdays aren't too bad. Not too expensive the total was about $40 before tip with my group of 3 people. Great place I definitely recommend for anyone looking for breakfast in Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Mr Mamas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken fried steak and eggs served with potatoes and toast
Photo of Mr Mamas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cali Omelette with pico on the side. Comes with potatoes and toast

_hB_XJoQdXriRGHshvUrJg.text: Everyone in our party loved their food.  Well run place and easy to get in and out of quickly since it is run so efficiently.  The owner Nick was super nice too.  We will definately be back when we are in town.

7J1LerqC8l_qnYzWZihjpw.text: I wish that I can give this place a 10 star rating. As we were walking in to the restaurant Shawn opened the door and shouted "Hello - how many" We later got visit by Mr Mama himself (Nick) were he shared his story with us and gave my wife a free cinnamon roll for her birthday. what a way to start my wife's birthday. Thanks guys!

wcAKzzz5in0L51Kg_nGFIQ.text: Fast and friendly service. Staff and crew are fast and accurate.  FOOD IS GOOD. Their homemade gravy is really good and the serving is huge! Even our 15 year old son was not able to finish his chicken steak. My eggs benedict is good but not something i will order again. But i will definitely come back to try other food.

photos.caption: Photo of Mr Mamas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Mr Mamas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Mr Mamas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

dkUoD6DS7sw-JikouTkFag.text: After Bella's dentist appointment at 8am, we decided to go have some breakfast and with Mr. Mamas earning a solid 4.5 star on Yelp, we dropped by and we are so glad we did.  Wow, the service is impeccable.  The kind gentlemen open the door to welcome us and quickly ask if we need a high chair and right when I said yes, he motioned for his team to set up the high chair so by the time we got to our table, there is the high chair.  Then as we are looking at the menu, the manager swung by and chit chatted with us, told us about the menu.  Very friendly.    Our waitress energy was a bit down, but she got our order right.  I got the corned beef hash with hash browns and sour dough toast.  Everything was good except for the toast, it was a more on the burnt side (I looked over at the neighboring table and their toast was perfectly golden brown vs. dark brown like mine).  The hash browns was the star...I finished it.   I give this place 4.5 Star.

VGwj-dXTPN9Bk6xmmN5UbQ.text: Love the food, the service, and the environment. I tried this place once on a limb and have been happily coming back ever since.  I can't imagine how anyone could have complaints about this place, but there are always those that want to complain.  The owner seriously does way more for the restaurant than you would expect an owner to do.  Talks to each table, inspects the cleanliness at all times, and even cleans up himself in order for his staff to focus only on the customer service, I assume.

photos.caption: Photo of Mr Mamas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

edKotCqq_OmiAOunW5NAGg.text: The kindest, friendliest, most upbeat staff I've ever seen. Every single person here is genuinely kind and happy, it really lifts your mood coming here. I never leave reviews but the staff here is truly outstanding. Please keep it up, customer service like yours is rare these days. I will definitely be coming back whenever I'm in town. The food is also incredible - unique spins on the recipes that I've never had before without over complicating things (as some places do in an effort to be trendy and then wind up ruining the basics). One of the very best places I've been to both in terms of staff/experience as well as the food.

KMNjGPAdwzbmbzG93ZK3Uw.text: We stopped in after church to check out this hotspot...  Chicken Fried Steak was very hearty and delicious and that cinnamon roll...ooey gooey goodness! No wonder it's always packed here, they know how to do breakfast!  Service is great here, and the owners are great people. It's funny listening to them on how Mr. Mamas got its name and start. Definitely one of the better breakfast spots in this area. Be prepared to wait, especially on weekends.  ALOHA!!!  Shaka Meter:  \uuu/  \uuu/  \uuu/  \uuu/  4

g3FkYwQRBG83B5jZzgoI1Q.text: First, I called the number of Mr. Mamas listed on Yelp on a Sunday morning to find out how long of wait it was.  There was no answer so I figured it was busy.  In about a minute, I got a call from Mr. Mamas asking  if I had called and what it was I needed.  I asked how long of a wait it was and he said that there were two tables left open right but we can sit you in about 30 minutes or less if they are filled up.  I definitely did not expect a call back.  That was awesome.  As for the food, my wife had the corned beef hash and eggs.  The hash was not mixed with anything other than corned beef and potatoes and this is just the way we like it.  No crazy onions or peppers.  I had the Chicken Fried Steak and Eggs.  The gravy was a little thick but really good.  If you don't like too much gravy, I would ask for it on the side.  The Chicken Fried Steak was excellent.  It wasn't full of breading and you could taste the meat.  Yum.  Best part about this place is how "on-point" they are about keeping the tables turning.  Once a family is done with their meal, they open the door for them on the way out and they are right on it, cleaning it up and getting it ready for the next family.  It is a testament to his initial introduction " We can sit you in about 30 minutes or less if they (tables) are filled up."

yATKe8nXrSJhzWpSJazBqQ.text: I had their Greek Omelet. It was extremely flavorful.  Everything we've had has been a hit with my family. The cherry on top is the amazing and friendly service. They higher and train the perfect people.

photos.caption: Photo of Mr Mamas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This is their crazy good and huge cinnamon roll. Definitely get this and share.

a06WT_eT1h_P9CXPpys7_A.text: As non-locals, we turned to Yelp for a breakfast place off the strip and close to the hotel. We knew we picked the right spot since there was a wait. Not long for us thank goodness!   This place is in a strip mall so plenty of parking. The sign has two burly guys dresses cooks but do not be frightened! They can cook! I went with the strawberry pancakes-strawberries inside and on top. Husband got the strawberry French toast. We shared hash browns with onions and peppers. As if this meal couldn't get any better, they offered flavored creamer for their delicious coffee. The bacon was crisp and not fatty. He got his eggs the way he liked them, soft scrambled, which doesn't happen often.   There was no reason not to wait! You will not be disappointed. Service was fast and the food was hot. The host was friendly and well as the wait staff. Even if we do not stay at that hotel again we will come back if in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of Mr Mamas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

M8ZE-zHkeccgqnIJr92OyA.text: Wow.  This place is BUSY.  Lots of happy customers.  From the moment we walked in we felt so welcome!  They open doors for you. They say good morning. They genuinely care about you and your business. True hospitality!  Claudia provided excellent service and we met Nick, the owner, who was greeting everyone in his restaurant.   And well... what you really want to know is about the food!! My Eggs Benedict Florentine was simply delicious!! My husband had 2 eggs with meat and raved about his breakfast. We shared a cinnamon roll!  Heated. Wow. More wow. Get one. Amazing.   FYI. LOL. I wanted to give only 4 stars because they don't have the Steelers, Penn State, or the Penguins represented, but Nick explained that customers have brought the sports memorabilia for him to hang up. Guess I need to "game up" next time I go.

photos.caption: Photo of Mr Mamas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Mr Mamas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Mr Mamas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

_OB7F9-4unruKpI5J5LDww.text: The place is marvelous. Friendly service, great prices, and huge portions. This is definitely a most stop in Vegas and folks need to add it as a great break from "The Strip"!!! It just a short drive and very worth it!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Mr Mamas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 2 egg breakfast with a pancake

CO91M7vwAq9CSVz740fYgw.text: This was an amazing breakfast. The food was great and the service was even better. It gets busy later into the breakfast timeframe and there were a number of people who were waiting when we left at about 1030am. I highly recommend this great off the strip location.

qRStGHhw0BRcoawyM0Va_A.text: Overall fabulous experience. Mr Mama himself is a wonderful person and the staff is very on top of everything. A couple of food items could have been better, which is why 4 stars rather than 5. But, next time I am in town I will be back. Would recommend.

mnfaPxcq6kJsEF-2tM7eYw.text: Wow!! Service 5 stars, environment A+, food AMAZING!! Will be back for sure :) I heard about the fantastic food all the way from Northern California and it was exactly as promised. Maybe even better!

pQw0pnZmUCYc4sT5lurG4Q.text: The waitresses and the manager "Ms. Kat" gave me and my family an amazing service! Everybody there is so kind! And the food, GREAT! I'm surprised to find this place, and for sure I will come back!! Small details, like welcome and open the door for u, that made my experience there amazing!

photos.caption: Photo of Mr Mamas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

MiG9AQbOXHeAo-or20Odfg.text: When to this place when I was in Vegas and YUMMY! Pretty packed all the time but it comes to tell you good food and great prices  when I'm Vegas you must visit!

jmM3qrDrRCqMnWJkKNgVow.text: The food was FANTASTIC!!!! I had the mama short stack, with bacon, and hashbrowns. Babe had the three meat omelette, hashbrowns, and a side of grits. Those grits were so good they made me want to slap the cook!! The staff was AWESOME! They were friendly, fun, and sweet! I highly recommend this restaurant. God Bless!

photos.caption: Photo of Mr Mamas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The best darn breakfast in Vegas!

aRiGjpJlYDGMf2gUpvvh0w.text: Arrived around 7:10am on a Saturday and there were plenty of seating available. Still so around 7:50am. Got the special of the day: french toast with strawberries, 2 eggs scrambled with added Cheddar cheese and coffee. Both were good, nothing spectacular. I liked how the cheese was melted in the scrambled eggs, as it should always be. Customer service was good, welcoming and friendly, right when we walked through the door. Free WiFi. Overall, a good breakfast place with standard breakfast meal options at a decent price.

photos.caption: Photo of Mr Mamas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Scrambled eggs with requested cheddar cheese
Photo of Mr Mamas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Special strawberry French toast

tyGWKzAOASRmRRQWky1Fug.text: A great breakfast spot with Detroit Michigan flavor. The owner Nick is a character, he walks around talking to all his customers.   The food is really good. I had the chicken fried steak and eggs and it was on point. The wife had French toast and she said it was good. It nice that it's away from the Vegas strip, so the prices are favorable.

OO6roYuvp4uOehAZ7QAuLQ.text: Mr Mamas brings the family feel with wonderful heartfelt breakfast goodness! We were greeted immediately by a pleasant woman and seated in less time than it took to walk in. Jose our server was on point with drink and food orders! Once the food arrived, less than 10 minutes after ordering we were indulging in chicken fried steak and French toast that is not comparable to others. Mr Mamas engaged us in pleasant conversation that made this spot very welcoming and comfortable! Definitely worth 5 stars!

photos.caption: Photo of Mr Mamas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French toast-light and fluffy
Photo of Mr Mamas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken fried steak, eggs, and house potatoes

C-Eb3h9Q17oWP9I9LcxEkA.text: Customer service is on point here! They have someone to open the door for customers. We came here on a Wednesday morning so it wasn't that busy, the hostess saw us coming in and she immediately directed the other host to go set up a table, then she led us to the table that's already been set up for us.   I got a veggie omelette with home fries, and my friend got pancakes with bacon and scrambled eggs. The portion was big we didn't finish our food, but the food was delicious and we boxed it for later.

photos.caption: Photo of Mr Mamas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Mr Mamas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

4DSYUdOq1_Ji0Zq2y6pg_w.text: We had a large party but they accommodated us in a short amount of time.  Nick the owner runs a great establishment and the food was really good.  Definitely worth the wait!!

JMuWU1OqXYm5xciS6Ujkjw.text: I REALLY debated writing this review. My reason, is because i am SELFISH and i dont want anyone else to find out about it because sometimes it gets busy on the weekend and there is a wait.  But... i guess i will share....  This place deserves a million stars. I cant say enough good things about this restaurant. First off when you walk in it is a typical ma and pop type restaurant feel. (At least thats the feeling i got). The hostess always greets you with a smile and anyone near by also greets you! If you are lucky you are seated right away. If not, your name goes on a list and you wait your turn for the plate of gold also known as their food!!! EVERY time i have gone into Mr Mama's, i have had AMAZING service and even better food!  I have more than one favorite... so it is hard to pick the best. The chicken fried steak is.... beyond perfect. SERIOUSLY, please do yourself a favor and put some of that heavenly goodness into your mouth.  The eggs Benedict is my go to 90% of the time i eat out for breakfast. I was NOT disappointed. And i order it more so than not!!!! Again, do yourself a favor and ORDER this! You wont regret it!  The service is outstanding, the food is mouth wateringly (i know thats not a word haha) perfect and the prices are fair and reasonable!!  BY FAR MY FAVORITE PLACE TO EAT IN VEGAS! I wish i could keep this a secret, but obviously the cat is already out of the bag... so i will tell you my little secret! :) Hope you all enjoy your food.

TP6CirqVy3Ch-RacuBAR2A.text: The best thing about Mr Mamas is definitely their customer service. They have intentionally set out to make this place feel like you're walking into your family's house. You're welcomed immediately with a smile and our server Jasmine took care of us the entire time.   The food- was your average breakfast comfort food. What sets them apart from their competitors is how they make you feel when you walk, how they treat you while you're dining and the impression you have when you walk away! Definitely worth coming too

photos.caption: Photo of Mr Mamas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

BOFoWgvY-bsnSCNogOrO9w.text: If you are in Vegas this restaurant is definitely worth visiting. Prices are very reasonable and the service is exceptional! The staff goes out of the way to welcome you and they work as a team to make the experience enjoyable. Also, the owner makes an effort to either receive you at the door or stop by your table to see if you need anything and make conversation. I especially liked the hostess, she makes everything run smoothly and has such a great personality

ac98xS0ALjQHwZLohptXEg.text: The food is great but the service is exceptional.    Very friendly, observant, and accommodating staff will make you want to come back.   Off the beaten path but worth the drive.

55CADxPUuAPyoOn7u1687w.text: This place is still amazing! The owners meet you at the door and are super friendly. The food is fantastic...what else can I say!

photos.caption: Photo of Mr Mamas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

rKKoaUQsdXxvp_QqSRuNWA.text: Holy fk! So good! Cannot say enough good things. The coffee is on point and my eggs benedict were stellar!! The home fries....ooooooooh! Lenore is more than helpful and her recommendations were spot on!

0kR5xLcGsPWa2bafBjJHaw.text: Wow!! For a mom and pop off the main strip excellent. There was a 30 minute wait but well worth it. I asked for a cup of coffee while I waited and they were happy to bring it to me. Definitely a locals spot but highly recommend to skip the hotel breakfast and visit the gem. Fresh, tasty food with pleasant service. Very affordable. I will return.

hrONStDpao4GVd5YWi6B1Q.text: Great breakfast, worth the Uber ride from the strip! My eggs Benedict was delicious and my husband's French toast was delicious!

bqdUrG6WSb9pVJ0eC6jyZA.text: Wait was about 20 mins, but food and service is great! Cant really beat that

CVRut8JfIISAonj_fDs0EA.text: My favorite place to hit in Vegas for breakfast...on week days. Weekends are too busy. The menu has a great variety, staff is super friendly, and service is quick. Real cornbeef hash! Not the canned mushy stuff. Everything I have tried wad great!

5PKnWxHreKbQaTFB9HtSVQ.text: Best Breakfast in Vegas! Pancakes-perfect! Omelet-perfect! We went back the next morning for seconds! Great service too!

QwUCRofDoZjbTa2OVHFunA.text: Delicious meal and great portion for what you pay for. I eat here 2 to 3 times a month and always love the hospitality, Texas toast, and the environment.

aLL6W9PnubNtSelf4lTJ9g.text: We were in vegas for vacation. I was in the mood for country fried steak and the place I usually go to stops serving breakfast at 11. So we looked on yelp and decided to give this place a try because of the great reviews. It was so worth it! The staff here is so friendly and the food was a good price, very tasty, and big portions!  Eileen was our server and she was great. Will come back!

VOuAD4T0U4rDmt_Ty6rqcg.text: We were greeted with a warm welcome at the door by the owner, Nick. This place was amazing. The food, the ambiance, all the staff was truly over-the-top. We are staying on the strip, but the 10 minute ride was well worth it. Generous portions of delicious food. Will definitely come back! Best of luck, Nick!  Fantastique!

Fx4XoQly0EyiwyepJcwRvg.text: I don't normally write reviews but this place definitely deserves a 5 star review. As we approached the door we were greeted by the owner and he made us feel like we just walked into our family home. The service was fast and the workers were all friendly. The food was great as well and the price is unbeatable. Definitely will come back here ! Overall great experience.

EXq0uwR03pbLJ89G4ri2GA.text: Awesome service & food. The pancakes are huge! I had the half order of biscuits & gravy & added a pancake. They make their gravy with a little maple syrup. It was really good & the sausage was high quality (no chewy pieces). The waitress offered to give me a sample to make sure I would like it.

jw_YY61hrEpkfYU2b9HFng.text: 2nd time here and wasn't disappointed.  Came in famished, left satisfied.  Breakfast was delicious.

Qed5gltcP0A1x_MnOe9obA.text: My friend liked her Denver omelet. I had the Veggie omelet the stuff inside was good except the texture of the eggs was Eeh, Flat and oily not fluffy and light like I expected. Subbed a pancake for toast. I asked for a liil bit of salsa and they charge $1.25.

74Hm2r-vlMCDAwNfpKE9XA.text: I would buy a plane ticket just to come back here from Colorado. The corned beef hash is quite possibly the best breakfast meal I have had at any restaurant ever. Also, bacon, sausage AND a touch of maple syrup in the gravy! Are you kidding me?! Phenomenal.

vUYfEqJe0l6xfpMcoAP3WA.text: Good food - just very crowded.  We felt a little rushed.  But, probably the best place you are going to find in Las Vegas for brunch.

Kp2icY3W8d1uvLUD6WCntg.text: Just had a fantastic breakfast here. Their French toast was very tasty as well. And the country gravy was the best.

aB6fSLnGnDUoqQwI9ES_PQ.text: Came here before leaving vegas on a Monday morning. Great breakfast. I had the Cali omelet. The aren't reinventing the wheel with breakfast just doing it right. Service is spectacular. They welcome you coming and going at the door and waitress jasmine was very prompt and friendly. Visitors should get off the strip for a afford great meal!

xIw5wwdmWYEAnm53TxKCXQ.text: Awesome Food. Great Prices. My normal waitress remembers my order. Customer service A++

oTQjCUwD55El75l3z3uZ_Q.text: My husband and I went to Mr Mama's today for breakfast. And you are talking two different eating styles...my husband being fond of sausage and bacon and me being a vegetarian that doesn't eat wheat or cheese. This place worked out well for both of us...the food was very, very good. Most striking though was the friendliness of the staff, all of them. Of note this trip was the gentlemen who greeted us at the door and our waitress, Jasmine, as well as the owner Nick, who was extremely personable and friendly. The experience was great all around and we would come here often if we were locals. We will definitely visit again next time we are back in town  - a Detroit native & a Southern California native

331_WnQnIaLssxnJlJpOxg.text: One of the reasons I love Yelp is if you're in a new location and have no idea where to go or what to do or what to eat, Yelpers are always there with good suggestions.  Mr Mamas was one that popped up as a must visit.  After going there, I can see why.  They have a serious breakfast menu with favorites like waffles, pancakes, omelettes, etc but there's a few specialties like Mamas homemade biscuits and sausage gravy.  For those who prefer something different there are burgers, chili, sandwiches, soup and salad.  I never had biscuits and gravy so ordered it.  Now I have a standard to measure all other biscuit and gravy places.  The biscuit was soft and buttery, the gravy was thick with chunks of meat with a hearty flavor poured over the scrambled eggs I ordered.  My advice is unless you eat enough for 2, then plan on getting one plate and splitting it.  Their portions are generous and food is good.  The servers were great and made you feel like you're a regular.  Highly recommend and I will definitely be going back!

photos.caption: Photo of Mr Mamas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ssVRFfGTveqj4PadyxqrUg.text: A great American breakfast place, but the food can often fall pretty bland and average. The service is fast and the staff is kind, but the food is nothing very special. It is a a great reliable choice after a night out but nothing special if you're trying to expand your food horizons

KGw8h0OOF2fcEC03xbQp0Q.text: What a pleasant surprise.  Great food.  Friendly staff. Relaxed atmosphere.  Nice menu.  Had breakfast and left with lunch for later.  Definitely a gem.

EAyRKpJdIwTwYr_eCmavyA.text: Second time was also a charm. I love the consistency of the service and the food.  I like also the fact that the staff are people and not robots.  The owner came to say hi and check in the diner, that's a really nice and caring touch.  I tried the egg and cheese sandwich with a side of pancake, leaving so full and ready to start the day properly.

OC200wHVHK7gVMKU6TmrRg.text: I think this place is good but a little bit lacking in a few areas. The prices are pretty high ($2.95 for coffee? It ain't Starbucks!), the servers seem too busy (didn't really go out of the way), the food was fine but not excellent, the hashbrown portion was pretty small, there was no real ambiance, and the cook yelled pretty loud (so don't sit near the kitchen).  On the flip side, the welcoming committee was friendly in greeting you & saying good bye, the place was super clean & pretty, the servers were pretty fast and thorough, the food was satisfactory, and you won't be disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of Mr Mamas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

4mtIAmfNnQ2CLDDFr4JZyA.text: Prepare for a long wait! Breakfast lunch food at its finest. Pretty yummy. Some things were bland for me. But all in all, I'd come back and try it again. Maybe my taste buds were weird that day .   Service was excellent. Even though it was busy, the server was attentive, she refilled our drinks without us having to Ask. The owner was around too! He spoke to each table to make sure they're okay. I think that's a wonderful thing, when the owner comes and talks to the customers !!

photos.caption: Photo of Mr Mamas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Country fried steak, chili omelette and biscuits and gravy!!

NIxePyKaVzlD2L0ZfE40uA.text: We wanted to try this place as our last stop in Vegas. It seemed so popular on Yelp. It has the vibe of a typical All-American breakfast/brunch place, similar to Hash House.  There's a parking lot with plenty of spots. It was late morning when we came but the place was pretty busy. I noticed that they had a large staff from waiters to receptionists, which definitely helped with efficiency and turnaround time. We ordered the chicken fried steak and eggs, which was not bad. Pretty filling actually. It's good for what it is, a quick breakfast place on the go. It certainly didn't blow me away or anything.

photos.caption: Photo of Mr Mamas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Mr Mamas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken fried steak and eggs
Photo of Mr Mamas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

m2bUiwZI27vRGOJHF8zIRw.text: We stopped here on our way out of town and had a good breakfast.  Found the restaurant via yelp, of course, and reviews convinced us to give it a try.  We had to wait about 15 minutes for a table when we got there because it was a busy Monday morning, which was totally fine.  Food was great when it arrived.  I ate every bite on my plate, which is really not typical for me with breakfast.  I had ham and eggs (scrambled) with sourdough toast.  The only thing about our experience that was lackluster was our waitress. She was obviously busy and had a lot to do but she was only mildly friendly, which was surprising after reading all the other reviews.  Food was great, location wasn't bad - we were staying on the strip but we had a car so it was easy to find and parking was plentiful. We would visit again.

photos.caption: Photo of Mr Mamas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ham and eggs

OSsZCoA9kCcGLI0etqBvsg.text: Excellent service and friendly. Traditional breakfast food, but I think the Love makes it more delectable. We were headed from NV to LA and yelped the spot. There was a significant line with several large parties. But the host (Sean?) was a quip and assessed our wait time to the tee. 8 minutes. Lol. The Hospitable team is a plus! Funny to hear their conversations across the room--from the Kitchen to the wait staff to the host... all to ensure efficiency and a smooth customer experience. Reminds you of family banter! Definitely try it. I also get the feeling the locals love this place too!  Large portions... we shared the Mamas French Toast Breakfast. Perfect for 2.  Ty

photos.caption: Photo of Mr Mamas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ehgITeSeQTNQWeSDgkfwNA.text: Wow, I'm so glad that my husband decided to take a little adventure off the strip!   This is a great spot to enjoy some history, friendly service, and delicious food for a decent price. It's the hustle and bustle of the place that kind of kept me captivated.   I appreciated that there were two people on a four top, and that there was enough room between tables that made it comfortable for people to chat with your table mates.   There was a huge variety of foods. My husband and I went for an omelette and a fried chicken dish. The omelette was delicious, the California twist. I added bacon instead of ham and mushrooms. My husband's dish was spectacular but a little on the heavier side. Both delicious and we would definitely be back.   My coffee was always filled and there wasn't a moment where I needed to flag down someone to get something. It was the perfect amount of attentiveness.   I'm definitely for coming back!

yyFiIq3SfU4i3PNRkH1Qog.text: Stopped in for lunch with a colleague and the food was okay. I had scrambled eggs with cheese, avocado, toast and hash browns and it was meh. This place was on my list of places to try since I moved here last year. The service was good, but I won't return.

16gBAbS0AyGjxJtQF_jT0w.text: We really wanted to like this place. We had eaten breakfast at an overcrowded, overpriced and not very good place the day before and were hoping for better luck. Right off the back, we could tell we were in a better place. really nice staff, friendly and happy. Service was fast and the owner clearly cares about his customers and takes the time to work the room and get to know his customers. All this was great.   The only problem, the food was really not that good. The house-made corned beef hash was made from good meat but dried out and burnt. The eggs were oily and cold, the breakfast meats were basically the stuff you'd get from a bulk food store like Costco and not the good stuff.  We so wanted to like it because the owner is such a great guy but the food was kind of a disappointment.

photos.caption: Photo of Mr Mamas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pancakes
Photo of Mr Mamas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crowded and long waiting is usually a good sign!

PWoJwyUAe59FWs2Zd9N3Ug.text: Husband and I visited Mr Mamas at husbands recommendation.  When I was pulling up and I saw a line of people waiting outside, I thought "whaaaat?  On a Wednesday morning?"  Husband assured me it would be fine.  We waited for about 10-15 minutes before we were sat.  First thing I noticed was how full the restaurant was.  At every single table were happy customers, eating, laughing, relaxed, conversating.  Our order was taken by Jazmin, who was very pleasant relaxed. We loved how she could take our order via her iPad-like device (and we found out later we could pay our bill the same way), making it clean and quick.  I ordered the French toast/w egg combo with a side of turkey bacon.  Husband ordered the Mamas burger (double cheeseburger) with onion rings.  Both our orders came out scrumptious and our drinks were never left empty.  I noted that the staff (I counted 9 working the floor and 5 working the kitchen) had been hustling but never at a point of anyone crowding or crashing with one another. Everyone knew what their and each other's jobs were.  Very efficient team.  I even noticed that the owner himself was hustling and had his head on a swivel, ensuring that everything was running smooth.  It was really appreciated that the manager, Cat, checked up on us at the end of our visit to make sure we were ok.  The bill was of a decent price and the service here was excellent.  This is a must recommend place, as I will be returning.

y_Q_-KWnGBPx69nV-uD97Q.text: Mr. Mama's is very welcoming and ran by good management.   It's always wonderful when you eat at a restaurant whose owners are active in the business.   The atmosphere is always on fleek.   My partner and I ordered country fried steak and eggs, corned beef hash and eggs & French toast.   Everything was amazing, very flavorful, no condiments needed.   My ice tea was filled twice by my waitress, before my cup was half way full.   4/5 members of their staff checked on us through out our meal.  I can't wait to go back and try other items on their menu.

b5UvublxDYGXS82F-AM67w.text: I found this amazing place great for breakfast and lunch on Yelp, I read a lot of positive reviews and saw lots of delicious pics of the food so after me and hubby check out of the hotel we headed to Mr mamas. As we pulled up we saw there was a small crowd that was waiting to be seated, we put our name down & in about 20 minutes later we were seated. Our waitress took our drink orders immediately the staff was so nice felt like home. It was our first time there so we asked for suggestions,  I was in the mood for breakfast so I ordered a pancake combo my husband wanted lunch, he got the mama burger which was humongous both were delicious! Our waitress kept checking on us to make sure everything was good and we didn't need anything.  The staff was amazing. We always like to have a good meal before we take the 3 hour drive back to Cali. Will definitely be bk  One negative this that the layout of the tables are a little awkward, if you place it differently you can add about 6 to 8 more tables which would seat more customers

Photo of Mr Mamas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mama burger w/o avocado

ezmw2JDedck12D2OscLpqg.text: It was my first time at Mr. Mamas. So far everything was exceptional; the service, the food and, the location.   We went here for Sunday brunch. It is to be expected that they were packed. The guy who took my name said it will be around 25-30 minutes wait. He was awesome at what he does by the way. He kept us updated the whole time and he explained to anyone who walks in that the time is just an estimate and that it is not guaranteed. When we were finally seated, our waitress Jasmine was really nice and attentive. My coffee cup was never close to being empty. The manager would also stop by to check on us and ask us if we need anything else. This place really knows how to make their customers feel at home.   We ordered eggs Benedict, a pancake and an order of biscuits and gravy. It was nice of Jasmine to give us a heads up about their gravy.  Their gravy is not regular gravy. It has bacon bits and maple syrup in it. It sounded interesting so we gave it a try. It was so delicious! It was creamy and rich but not too heavy. The biscuits were crispy so it blends so perfectly with the creaminess of the gravy. The pancake was not dense and had a good texture. The benny was also amazing. The eggs were seasoned well and the bacon was cooked until it is crispy but not dry/hard. The hash browns were to die for! It was crispy on the exterior but was still soft and moist on the insides.   I highly recommend this place. Good food and good price.

kMNwRj1meZFhYI6IK-lUcA.text: Good food. Really like the owner of his friendly service. Good staff. We had brunch there.

VIXae67LmZJfPY1dw_Iqgg.text: When I come to Vegas every year, I look forward to checking out small local places off The Strip. And this one is definitely a winner! We visited the restaurant late Monday morning, and it was just about busy. We barely had to wait 3 minutes before we were seated. The staff are really efficient and kept the tables cleared very quickly, which meant you'd most probably not have to wait very long!  I had the French Toast with two sunnyside up's and turkey bacon on the side. No complaints. My friend had the Eggs Benedict Florentine and was very happy with the eggs and hollandaise sauce. Our portions were just about right which was great! Denisse served us and was such a darling, making sure everything was perfect during the meal. Can't wait to come back next time I'm in Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Mr Mamas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yumyum!!

i18e9bcRlXD3-6gEcEbTXw.text: Great food! I got the Cali omelette with egg whites which were the fluffiest egg whites I've ever had. The cinnamon rolls were also yummy  Also service was amazing! Definitely will be back when we are back in town.

4AzwSSIFstPs-LLtVw18Ww.text: I absolutely love this place! The service was beyond amazing! Talk about great teamwork and amazing customer service! I mean this place makes you feel good. You got people checking on you with smiles on their faces, staff thanking you when you leave for coming in and people holding the door open for you when you leave saying "Have a beautiful day!"  I mean wow oh wow these folks are great! I told my fiance that we're definitely coming back here not only for the exceptional service but the wonderfully delicious food as well!  So, as some of you might know by now my go to breakfast food is eggs benedict! I think I'm addicted. How can one resist that perfectly poached egg and buttery hollandaise sauce? It's impossible! As soon as my fiance saw it on the menu he said "I know what you're getting!"  I thought maybe just maybe today I would try something new like a wrap but nope... I failed. I'm sure glad I went with my go to dish because it was ahhhhhmaaaazzzzing! The egg was perfectly poached, loved how it drizzled over my Canadian bacon and English muffin as I cut into it. Yum! And the hollandaise sauce?! Man, I couldn't get enough! Yum, yum and more yum! I passed on the hash browns and got a side of grits because well, I'm a Texas girl and I love my grits. They were perfectly made and came with two butters. Yep, used them both. Nope, don't feel bad about it at all.   Man oh man just writing this review has me reminiscing about that amazing breakfast and maybe drooling a little. Can't wait to go back!

kjIRzoZVVhrsVZumsJfQmA.text: After reading wonderful reviews, my husband and I drove from the Orleans for breakfast. We were greeted at the door and were seated after a very short wait. Our drink orders were taken quickly while we looked over the menu.  The restaurant seemed very clean and all of those who worked there were cheerful. We both chose Mama's short stack--two eggs, bacon, and two pancakes for $7.95.  Eggs and bacon were prepared just as we requested and the pancakes were wonderful--very light and fluffy.  We will return.

5X4HteGmldFVhqzniZMYVw.text: The service rocks! Mr Mama talks to every person who walks in the door. The food is very good and fast to the table.

-w59t8Ljxcnj5v6Ag6xnNQ.text: We were looking for somewhere to have a tasty breakfast and given that this has great reviews we decided to give this place a try and we have no regrets. Wait time was reasonable and the food was delicious! I had the steak and eggs plate and for once in my life they did not say no to cooking my eggs the way I like them. They have great customer service! And Although we are from out of state, I will definitely keep this on my list of places to visit when in town.

u0oE1W1aDTfgb0K2dpGQcA.text: Overall, a Very Nice Experience"  Six of us arrived for breakfast at 10am, and the place was still about 80% full... good sign! The door was opened, and we were welcomed with a smile by Mr. Mama himself. There is no pretentiousness about this place. It is just one large room with tables and chairs, no booths. The server was on us instantly, asking for our coffee, juice and water order, with no pressure for the breakfast order... Nice! I ordered 2 pancakes and a side of sausage patties, both were perfect. The pancakes are fluffy, and nearly the size of the plate, (glad I didn't order a "stack" which is 3 pancakes). A stack with a side would be enough to feed an adult and two children. The rest of our group had similarly sized portions of eggs, potatoes, etc. One of our group had the home made corned beef hash, one of the best ever! The server was attentive, constantly checking coffee refills and making sure we were otherwise satisfied. Mr. Mama showed a genuine interest in our satisfaction, thanked us, and asked us to return.

LZOpqlk5Nux3guys7KPACg.text: You know a place is pretty good when there's 350+ reviews and has a solid 5 stars. Also when you show up to have the owner welcome you in is something you don't see very often. They food was absolutely AMAZING for an AMAZING price!!!! I got the Marty Wrap which has avocado, pepper jack cheese, crispy bacon, eggs, and potatoes. I will definitely be back next time I'm in Vegas. If you haven't been to Mr. Mamas yet, you're missing out!!!

GWVfF1_CCS5udm4D-e-FfQ.text: The food and service were pretty good. The reviews led me to believe I would be having a revelatory experience, which I did not. It was simply...adequate.  If I go back it will be at 7:00 a.m. The wait time at 9:45 was pretty long.

6fJ7Pr9hipeaJrXtlah0dw.text: I wanted to find a great restaurant to eat breakfast for my birthday so after reading a FB group post and Yelp reviews about how great the food was at Mr. Mamas, we took a chance on eating here. My husband and I were not in the least disappointed that we did. Relocating from Georgia, it's not easy to find restaurants that serve grits but Mr. Mamas was one of the few who did. My husband ordered the Denver omelet and I ordered the short stacks. They should be named "huge stacks" for how enormous they are. Everything was off the chain and the portion sizes are great. We were so full that we couldn't eat all of our food and we didn't even touch the cinnamon roll that my husband ordered. When I told the server that it was my birthday, he didn't hesitate to have them fix me a free cinnamon roll to-go. What a thoughtful birthday gift! Not only was the food fresh and scrumptious- the service was superb. The waitress and hostesses were very attentive and so friendly. We highly recommend eating at Mr. Mamas and we will be coming back too.

photos.caption: Photo of Mr Mamas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Mr Mamas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Mr Mamas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

sO3S107F2-sdzdj9FNbMBA.text: I normally like to wait until I've visited an establishment a few times before leaving a review but this place warrants an exception.  Background: I came here with a friend who is supremely picky but raved about the food. I set my expectations low but was totally blown away.  Atmosphere: the vibe in this place is very down home, down-to-earth, no fuss, no frills. It's simply (if somewhat sparsely) decorated and most of the tables are pretty much the same faux stone and wooden edged two-and-four-tops with pull out chairs.  Food: everything is generously sized, delicious and homemade. The pancakes are the size of dinner plates and the option of fresh fruit or chocolate chips. The biscuits and gravy were fantastic. With sausage gravy, it's easy to make it too heavy but this wasn't overwhelming. The home fries didn't come out of a bag and the hashbrowns with peppers, cheese, and gravy was a pretty inventive combination that sounds weird on paper but was actually great.  Service: our waitress Crystal was fantastic and rolled with it when we asked to split three different dishes. She was friendly and attentive and very personable. The manager, Cat, was also super great and friendly with everyone.  I will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Mr Mamas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. (Almost) the whole table of food.

wZFX72lLsbLybWkT74OSeg.text: Wow! Hearty breakfast for a great price. Be prepared to wait for a table because this place is popping. Food was prepared to order but came out quickly.  Great customer service from the greeters to servers. I will definitely return.

bsdlN4sx6H52YbWtBwpL0Q.text: First time customers and we were blown away. We just had the best customer service from the host, to our server, Alex, and from the manager checking on us. The only thing better than the customer service was our breakfasts. Steak, eggs, bacon, potatoes and toast were perfect! All followed up with great coffee and constant refills. We will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Mr Mamas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best bacon ever!
Photo of Mr Mamas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yum!

F_IYZni8Wl-6abIBkMNkrg.text: Fabulous home cooked breakfast.  Super busy with a wait...but it's worth the wait.  They are very efficient getting people served and tables cleared right away.  You won't be disappointed!

cs5IHR6H4cXuJSNIsgsNxg.text: Our order:  Biscuits and gravy Denver omlet  Country Fried Steak  Review: The biscuits and gravy weren't good to me only because I'm used to a different flavor profile. They put a little bit of maple syrup in it so it's a little sweet. The hash browns were amazing!  The Denver omlet is HUGE! It's delicious and the portion of egg to cheese to vegies to meat are very balanced.   The Country Fried Steak was very good and the potatoes we ordered with it were delicious. It has the sweet gravy they use on the biscuits and gravy so just ask to taste the gravy first.   Overall the service was A+++ 100%! I love the waitresses, they are on top of drink refills and are amazingly nice! (Make sure to tip because they actually deserve it).

n3HxD4Id4v_XXWOETwkVCw.text: Their California omelet is perfecr to split because their portions are so large. And their customer service is on point! The waitress accommodated our request to take an order to go and we ordered when our food came out so that we can get it fresh to go. She even took the time to write a nice note on the receipt and everyone smiled and thanked us when we left. Even on a weekday this restaurant seems busy and banging. This is the spot to go when you want a no frills breakfast or brunch. Definitely recommend coming back here.

9zMWpfX0y8AhpF2RSlubSA.text: Excellent food and great service from everyone!! My boyfriend and I had the western omelet and Greek omelet and side of pancakes  delicious food! Definitely worth the drive and money! Workers are super nice and friendly. Thanks.

w2VTJEiSIQH_38VrC5upZA.text: Awesome hearty Americana it was better than I expected and was referred by a couple buddy's who gloat about the place. Food awesome service could have been better.

85LAMlT8qj8zWnqAjvs8Sw.text: Great breakfast spot. Servings are plenty the food taste great.. The customer service is wonderful. Staff was very friendly and accommodating.  The manager noticed that I was super tired and they brewed and extra strong pot to wake me up. They were so super friendly making sure that we were completely  satisfied. I will definitely be returning!

W0iKdQSdp0xfgSvp9xvJTQ.text: We showed up around 9:20am on a Saturday morning and had to wait about 15 minutes. Very quick service and very friendly. Cinnamon roll was super good. Large portions my hubby and I shared an omelette and French toast. A little pricey for breakfast but you will not be disappointed.

CUt6nKZz9FSMiZgYybhzOg.text: Long ago outgrowing the limited confines of their previous location, a visit in September of 2014 finding the small and narrow restaurant completely full, Mr. Mama's relocated to the corner of South Jones and West Russell Road the following March, late Breakfast over two-years later still finding the mom 'n pop place packing 'em in from open to close with waits as long as an hour on weekends for food that is affordable and competent, no less and no more.  Inexplicably one of Las Vegas most heavily Yelped! Businesses, the only presumed reason being that low prices and big portions are a selling point for that particular demographic as the online deal offering $30 of food for a $15 pre-purchase expired long ago, it was with another adult plus a ten year old boy that the group checked in at the podium just past noon on a Saturday and waiting alongside four twenty-somethings who Uber'd from the Strip plus a couple passing through from Utah for nearly thirty minutes the scene was nothing short of controlled chaos, servers moving at a steady clip with a manager directing traffic while intermittently snapping pictures of another full house.  Eventually landing a table along the north wall of the restaurant, the current location not doing much to upgrade the decor but nearly tripling the number of seats with an equivalent increase in servers and kitchen size, it was by an identical menu from three years ago that diners were greeted, a few daily specials including Pancakes or French Toast slathered in canned Fruit Compote immediately passed over in favor of a two-plate and three sides order tallying just over $50 prior to tip.  Literally filled to capacity until their 2pm closing time, no waiting diners turned away but the Open/Closed sign flipped over and no further seating allowed after the designated time, it was with a small glass of Milk and two Iced Coffees that the table waited another thirty minutes after seating for the whole order to be delivered at once, the house "Iced Coffee" similar to McDonald's in that it comes with Cream and Sugar already added while the Hot Brew poured over Ice is watered down and weak, though both are offered with endless refills for just three dollars.  Interestingly hiding prices on their website, an odd choice as most of the diner-staples ring in at a pricepoint similar to the big chains or other locally owned joints such as EggWorks or The Cracked Egg, it was with the table quickly flooded that pictures were taken and share plates were passed, the "Mama's Stack" putting sides of Sausage and Scrambled Eggs on a separate plate as the fluffy triple-stack overlapped its dish with Strawberries and Whipped Cream strewn on top, the addition of Pure Maple Syrup from home again showing the Pancakes to be rife with Buttermilk, not too dense and among the best in town.  Moving next to the Chicken Fried Steak, not a typical order but considered to be one of Mr. Mama's signatures and interesting enough in that regard to justify its $12.95 cost inclusive of three sunny-side Eggs, an unfortunately dry Biscuit and previously-frozen Homefries, suffice it to say there is nothing light about Sausage Gravy atop a pounded piece of deep fried Beef and although fans of the dish may say this is as good as it gets the fact of the matter is that it is certainly an acquired taste that did not go over well with 2/3 of the table thanks to the thick and largely flavorless Country Gravy.  Mistakenly ordering an extra Biscuit, the addition of some honey definitely improving things to at least a point of edibility, those looking for something far better would do well to order one of Mr. Mama's famous $3.50 Cinnamon Rolls, the yeasty curl piping hot beneath thick frosting while a similarly priced side of Onion Rings is enough to go around the table several times with crisp batter and nary a hint of greasiness.    **1/2:  A pleasant enough place, though clearly one who has generated a following by way of low prices as opposed to quality cuisine, Mr. Mama's reminds one of the sort of diner food that spawns big crowds after church in a small Midwestern town where creativity is for lack and abundance matters most.  FYI: Those looking to use coupons would be well advised to expect a wait, math not exactly a strong suit for the staff and the middle-aged male cook with a pot-marked face who may or may not be the owner clearly a loud and greedy man who does not understand the idea of 'fine-print.'

1vN9fBqpiXwPyjN3jzI6Ig.text: This is our go to breakfast place when we visit Las Vegas. The staff is fantastic and the food is the best. I highly recomend the corn beef hash.

zCYnYKafRnYADtEwMfz6Gw.text: This has been one of my favorite breakfast spots until this past weekend.  The food, staff and atmosphere has been historically a great experience.  However, I came here at 10:30AM on a Saturday morning with my two sons and as other yelpers have mentioned the parking lot has become nothing short of a tailgate party with many mid 20's millennials loitering the parking lot unknowingly waiting to be seated.  I came in and there was so many people I could have easily been labeled as someone who already was waiting.  Nobody even greeted me, had to call for the hosts attention several times, she was a little short with me and finally put my name on the list and she tells me 50 minutes to an hour to wait!  You have got to be kidding me?!  Please, hire more staff, welcome your guest with open arms and at least maybe create some outdoor seating so it doesn't look so uninviting to come to, because I honestly don't want to feel as if I'm another number.  Not sure if I will come back again because of this.  After 20 minutes of waiting, no where to sit outside and very antsy children I had no choice but to leave and go elsewhere.  I don't think I'll be back.

qT3L9ewII3yKv39ZMfponw.text: We were visiting Las Vegas from California and found this place on Yelp. We tried it for breakfast on a Saturday - waited about 30 minutes but the staff was super nice and even thanked us for waiting. Our group ordered chicken fried steak, corned beef hash, eggs Benedict, and pancake stack. We all thought it was great and very reasonably priced. It's your standard breakfast food. Nothing like the best you've ever had but good to make you want to come back. Our server was attentive and gave us ice water and refilled coffee promptly. We left really stuffed and ready for a nap! Spent $60 including tip for 4 people. Very good when we were trying to avoid an overpriced breakfast buffet. We would definitely come back and try lunch items.

RB6oMaVKiadjttlkhNN5rA.text: The cook was caughing over the food wiping his nose and touching the food without washing his hands or covering his mouth.  I won't be going back.

GJ3zB_o_A2gJzfApT_yOUg.text: This place deserves 10 stars!! OMG!! The breakfast was amazing!! I couldn't eat all my food..they give you so much..Its enough for two ppl..I got the mamas stack:3 huge pancakes, ham, eggs and I added a hash brown..delicious!!! The price was reasonable..next time I'm in Vegas this will be the only place I will eat breakfast...4 days later and I'm still just in awe!!
