bG-Zlc7N6hpkeX3h3Av1FQ.text: Mr. Mamas exceeded our expectations for food and service. love this place!!! Quality of the food makes you Nostalgic for great conversations with family and friends around one table sharing a great meal. Best food in town!!   I love your food so much I've been telling all my Passengers on my shuttle to come dine with you. I tell them to tell you"Diane sent them."

vf4o6yY20p1TnPKZgX2grg.text: This is the one spot in Las Vegas everyone has to check. Food and service are five star! There a lil bit of the wait but it's all worth it.   I will recommend to try : Cinnamon roll   Mama's Chicken Fried Steak  Denver Omelette  Eggs Benedict Florentine

wOoxBk8tFK85TMmDa48fSw.text: We saw this place on Trip Advisor and decided to check it out. It's pretty far off the strip, about 7 miles, but well worth the Uber! The food was awesome. I had French toast and biscuits and gravy. My husband had steak and eggs. The food was really tasty. They were swamped but they had a good system and got us in quicker than expected. We heard you should get the cinnamon roll, so we did and it was so good!!  Definitely a great spot on your trip to Vegas. Cheaper than the strip and much better food and service as well!!

SwjniNJb9BQVg3nOi9KlIw.text: Nick, a.k.a. "Mr. Mama", knows the recipe for a restaurant to be successful and survive for a long time: great food, good prices, good vibes, and friendly, happy staff.   From the moment you enter, you sense that the staff care about their customers and the work they do.  While it can be pretty crazy during peak times, such as when I went, staff worked well as a team.  Because of that, while it was super busy, there was never a sense of chaos or staff that were run off their feet.  I also appreciated how Nick took the time to constantly go around the restaurant connecting with the patrons.  We had the popular fried chicken as well as the rib eye steak and eggs and a side of waffles.  They were good picks and solid breakfast items.  The chicken with gravy was good-sized and fried just right. I liked that the gravy was not overly salty as is the case at many other places.  The steak was very tender for a breakfast (i.e. thin) steak.  Again, just the right size for breakfast.  Thank you Mr. Mama for creating a good memory. I'll be back.

K2ZjniEEgTzb9KSPoQ8Oyw.text: Best breakfast in Las Vegas! Came here to get off the strip and some good food other than a buffet or overpriced food such as Hash House a Go Go.  So impressed, I can speak for everyone in our group. The food, atmosphere, employees, and owner were all so friendly.  We will be back, thanks for being awesome!

x7yTvph3WME8pIlLK3K9Kw.text: Hands down the best biscuits and gravy I've ever had and I've had lot of biscuits and gravey will definitely be coming back for sure reccomend anyone near here to stop and eat again must stop here

photos.caption: Photo of Mr Mamas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hands down the best biscuits and gravy

mvq5OYuEqtQWH1RoXDu-oA.text: Excellent food and service- the owner even goes to each table to make sure it's all good- and it was!

nUHXjuTUOiRE9l_9bUp4oQ.text: Met Mr. Mama! So polite and made sure our food and service was great.   Both were great. Speedy service and food was taste great. You can tell the staff members work as a team to ensure the customers have everything they need. Which is great because this place gets busy!!   We enjoyed our first visit and will be returning.

NCnxakpRTl28HFLX1vIyDw.text: Breakfast was Perfect!!!  Plenty of good good.  We had home made corn beef  hash, and chicken fried steak.  All very flavorful! To top it off, we had a cinnamon roll! Freshly made, one of the best I have had.  Our server, Jose Garcia was fantastic.  AAA+ Rating

Q9mrkv6VFBijibjyqOR2yQ.text: Off strip but run like a top flight on strip breakfast spot. We took a Lyft to get there I wasn't feeling that great since getting over my anxiety. Man, the staff operate as one awesome crew. The wait was about half an hour since they don't rush you through your meal. The Eggs Benedict was offered to me with multiple options on how well done I wanted my egg. It arrived only a few minutes later. The coffee was fantastic and you could tell it was just brewed. Definitely the breakfast spot to go to in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Mr Mamas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

B76Dsb0NJxI07nVFJbcCeA.text: Great place. On the outside it looks like it's gonna have a huge wait but even at its busiest time we waited about ten minutes.   The food is good. I had the blackened steak(I think that's what it's called) and it had a bit too much seasoning which made it hard to enjoy the meat but I asked for very very rare and I got that so it's forgivable.   This feels like a mom and pop place because the people here treat you like it's family breakfast. They seat quickly and the waitress we got topped our drinks without having to be asked. She frequently checked on us and made sure we were taken care of. It's not super pricey just watch out how many things you "add on" because it can get pricey .   The customer service made me happy though. Very much recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Mr Mamas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

5GFnWmZik4SRWSreLdb-qg.text: Straight up an old-school diner. The menu is extensive but not overwhelming. You will more than likely wait for a table but the service is quick. The receptionist at the door was very friendly and told me it would only be about 15 minutes and he said if you can't wait 15 minutes for their food then you should probably go somewhere else. He was joking of course.   If you have small children it is probably best to order one breakfast for them and split it between them. I am giving you fare warning that the short stack of pancakes is enough to satisfy Paul Bunyan and his pal Babe the blue ox. Seriously, it was a lot of food for my kids and most of it went to waste. My wife ordered a cinnamon roll and that thing is about the size of a water balloon. It was a lot of roll, so I did what good husbands do and I ate most of it. She also went with a veggie omelet and said it was good. I had the country fried steak. They make a special gravy for it. It is plenty of food for you to share. I was feeling like a pig that day, so I truly was what I ate.   It's a great place to stop for breakfast. Excellent service and great food. Simple and inexpensive. Get away from that resort you are staying at and make the drive just a few minutes west of the strip. I guarantee that it will be much better than that overpriced breakfast available downstairs at your hotel (that's unless you are staying at the best hotel ever with incredible breakfast). I'm sure the locals want to keep this place a secret. Happy eating!

photos.caption: Photo of Mr Mamas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veggie omelette
Photo of Mr Mamas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken fried steak with 3 eggs
Photo of Mr Mamas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. How am I going to eat this?

nyJ6KmpKWJATDl3RKzsPJA.text: As soon as we walked in the door, we were greeted by very nice hostess. She sat us right away. Then the very sweet server took our drink order. It's apparent the employees have great team work  and they seem genuinely happy working there. The food was delicious. Pancakes were fluffy. After our meal, they offered us coffee to go which was really nice. My 6 year old son complimented the owner on a wonderful breakfast. To our surprise he gave us a cinnamon roll to go! My son was pretty excited about that. Next time we're in Vegas, we are definitely coming here for breakfast!

f0I8QgaviLLiWiXD1zAY2g.text: Worth the 30 min wait... 100%  Delicious food and great service/breakfasts at reasonable prices!

b-N7mlZ87bqbiy7m3f0r0g.text: We really like Mr. Mamas. The staff are super friendly and you can't go wrong with breakfast. They are always super busy so try to get there early. This was our second visit and we will be back again in the future. My only complaint is all the ceiling fans turning at different speeds is difficult for me since I have an inner ear dysfunction called Meniere's.

photos.caption: Photo of Mr Mamas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

rgtr9b0SzqIC5j9er7L_lw.text: The prices, portions, service, and food all score high for me, and I'm betting this place goes up another star on my next visit.   I had the French toast and the western omelette. French toast wasn't world changing, but it was good. I like salsa with my eggs. It costs 1.25 extra but it made my omelette extra delicious. Most of their omelette combos (includes regular toast and your choice of potatoes) cost less than $10, a great value. There doesn't seem to be a charge for substituting one veggie for another.   Tip: the western omelette doesn't come with cheese. No big for me, but I just assumed omelets came with cheese.   I'm looking forward to coming back and trying their well-reviewed biscuits and gravy

cCX3vsdmP14kCfJve500BQ.text: Service is fast & friendly and food is good with generous servings. It was the best and least expensive breakfast my family has had while in Vegas. Thanks, Mr. Mamas!

ZzwEauNx_sMYEgZPZ5ZPtQ.text: I ordered benedict and it was average. The bread was too sweet for a savory dish and it was mushy. Coffee was good and the service was friendly.

UeGJ2H01NOOn_kEen9j6ew.text: Pancakes the size of a dinner plate?!  Fresh, scrumptious bacon?  Eggs cooked just right?  Count me in!!  This place had excellent reviews and it did NOT disappoint.  The space is kind of tiny and definitely popular/busy, but the service was excellent and the food was awesome as well.  I had the Mama's Stack and my companion had the BLT sandwich.  Both were excellent and tasty.  Would definitely visit again!

photos.caption: Photo of Mr Mamas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Breakfast!

T_x37MepnCkwWri0qb2YFw.text: SHOUT OUT TO THE MANAGER she gave us the best customer service I have ever had in my life! You the best!  We ordered basically the entire menu and were over the moon and not disappointed with ANYTHING we ate. I even had the cinnamon roll 2 days later and it was sooooo good!  My favorite thing about this place was the quality for the price and the portion size. All fantastic and I will now dream of their chunky thick bacon until I am able to be reunited with that heavenly cut of meat.

Ql1WRq4g-BR_nW4AvWTgMQ.text: We were out running errands and looked for a breakfast place on Yelp that was nearby and Mr. Mamas came up with great reviews.  We went on a Sunday around 10:00 am.  No wait at that point but when we left there was a 20 - 30 minute wait.  I can say that the service was exceptional.  And food was great!  I got the Jenna breakfast wrap which is eggs cooked over hard with avocado, jalapenos and a bunch of other great stuff with delicious spicy salsa on the side.  My husband ordered breakfast eggs, meats, and English muffin a la carte and all were great.  We'll go back!

azfNOvz7U2pdtDTjeUXf6A.text: This place is pretty good. Service is awesome. Little bit of a wait but we came at peak breakfast hours. Our waitress was so sweet. Food came out fast. And they serve a good amouby if food.

xGfFSf5mSFC1B13B-O8D2g.text: Great service food was average at best.  Had the the Cali omelet and it barely had any sausage in it, pretty disappointing  The hash browns are good Again great service with average food

LANJG8mYQooRBeowxzJTug.text: That sausage gravy!!! I don't even like gravy, but that sausage gravy with the biscuit is the bomb.com. Must try! Came here for brunch after a long night out on the strip, and it was some much needed delicious food! There was a 30-40min wait when we got there around 11:30am, which was no big deal seeing as it was lunch time. Customer service was awesome. The host was hilarious- he was so extra with the picture taking and I loved it. Our waitress was so nice and courteous. Our food came out quickly too.

Rk-yM5z23tOB3BlCIFaX9A.text: Hands down amazing!!! The staff is super friendly!!! Service is quick!! And the taste of the food is... well go give it a try and u will see!! I have been to several breakfast locations around the county and I have a new favorite!!!

Ojl1SvpduDUM8f97zW_42w.text: First and foremost, the customer service at this place is stellar! Kat, the restaurant manager made it a point to greet my husband and I after we were seated and gave us some menu suggestions. I had questions about the ingredients in their sausage gravy and she went a step further and offered me a sample of it. It was delicious and that sealed the deal for my husband who went on the order the chicken fried steak and eggs which is covered this gravy. I ordered the Cali omelet which she said was their most popular omelet. Manager also informed us that our toast can be substituted for a pancake with no additional charge so that is what we both did.

Gs3NeZDjQjhRoIZUmy8iPA.text: Came for breakfast Perfectly cooked Great service, quick and polite and friendly Offered To go drinks...  We will come back

1ebac43hQFfVoqNTRg311A.text: Came here for breakfast a few weeks ago while I was in vegas for a music festival.   We got here right when they opened on a Saturday so there was no wait. My boyfriend ordered the chicken fried steak and I ordered the corn beef hash.   Mine was good and simple but my boyfriend's chicken fried steak was delish; super tender and a good size too. I think we both agreed it was the best chicken fried steak that we've ever had as well.   Service was good and attentive as well. Owner was super friendly and inviting.

GnQ31qAkbo1I25eev1mjMA.text: Food Was Great And The Staff Was Very Kind And Sociable. There Was A Bit Of A Wait But We Were A Large Group And It Was Worth The Wait.

PaeAzebKVXPmcbeWnImepg.text: Mr. Mamas is the greatest breakfast place of all time. They have a great service staff and the food is incredible. I had the make your own omelette and it was perfect. The portions are great sizes and for a good price.

Oamq11V_CAAZgC_gSrUEww.text: WOW.  Post workout vibes with all the carbs. Rolled in and didn't have to wait long on a Saturday morning around 8:15am. The restaurant was packed but we were the first on the waitlist and the hostess was so kind. We initially were a party of four but a friend decided to join last minute and although we added a bit more time to our wait, we were assured that it wouldn't be an issue and we were sat in about fifteen minutes.  The menu has a little bit of everything. I was pulled towards the burrito but the corned beef hash is what won me over. It's not shredded corned beef, which is my favorite, but the hash was crumbled and packed with salty and rich flavor. The hashbrowns were wildly crispy and my over medium eggs were yolky and divine. I opted for their swirled rye and made perfect bites on the buttery toast. My table shared two of their cinnamon rolls and OH. MY. GOD. They were gooey and rich, covered in frosting with every bite.   There was a gentleman walking around and he offered to take a photo of our group saying, "You need a family photo." He stood up on a chair in a busy restaurant to take several photos of us on my phone. He worked there and was just doing a nice thing. It caught me by surprise and was definitely appreciated.   Oh, and the coffee was good. A lot of breakfast spots overlook their roasted bean treat but Mr Mamas did it right. Really looking forward to going back again.

k-gxK9uyitm1onKLfu--EQ.text: Visited Vegas last month for a concert and since I'm not familiar with the area I relied on yelp to find the best places to eat at. I came here for breakfast with my boyfriend because of the great reviews and it was probably the best experience I've ever had at a restaurant. Everyone was super friendly and the service was amazing. You could really tell they value their customers which I appreciate. The food is way better than places like Denny's or iHop and much more affordable than them as well. Anytime I visit Vegas I will make sure to always return to this restaurant.

E0-wDU58CifFJ-FY9B98JQ.text: Love coming here when we are visiting Vegas. Be prepared it wait- 40 min on a Saturday, 10am, for party of 4. Definitely worth the wait. Cinnamon roll is a must! Great friendly staff. Kept the coffee flowing the whole time. Everything is delicious. Can't wait for the next time.

TOBCmD-WlDtJ9ERr7vutHQ.text: Great place for a hearty breakfast. Friendly service and atmosphere. Had something for everyone in my family and we were all satisfied. We loved this place!

oLWZ0INkHNaKF-9BwCYZ_A.text: Mr. mamas great reviews are what drew me into the restaurant, and they were all completely accurate! We love this place. The service is fantastic, the menu is fantastic, the food is fantastic, the prices are great. We just happened to be on vacation for four days in Las Vegas. I used to live in Spring Valley, and I wanted to get away from the strip and take my family out somewhere more in my old neighborhood. Something that was a little bit more real in Las Vegas. This was the spot! If I ever go back to Las Vegas again, this will be our breakfast spot, hands down.

KdTj0D0clADFkanarkRXbg.text: Great food and outstanding service. Best breakfast I've had in Las Vegas. Had to wait about 20 mins to be seated but the food was well worth the wait. Highly recommended.

nP9mm_yxNIOBHA7ocSHUdw.text: All I can say is.... AMAZING!! The chili was incredible and the chicken fried steak made me cry happy tears. Whoever Mr. Mama is, I love you!!

poHcS7IsabpqvefclHKPog.text: Sat me next to kitchen and server station with a bunch of other tables available (party of one). Sat white man that came in after me at a nice window table (also a party of one). Gave me a server that had JUST been sat with two 4 tops so of course I had to wait about 10 minutes to actually see him. Food selection is just ok. There is only pork on the breakfast menu so only choice was a burger at 9 AM. Of course the burger came back well done after I stressed multiple times that I wanted it cooked medium. dEXMwR2AksOHK0am4ZQ8Lw.text: This place is a very popular and solid brunch choice in the Spring Valley/Enterprise area. It is crowded pretty much anytime it is open. However, the food is well worth the wait. It is made fresh to order and takes so little time to come out fresh that I couldn't believe it. We had our food maybe 5 minutes after we ordered it, and it was perfectly prepared. Everything was fantastic. We all ordered the pancakes and others got the hash or eggs and everything was delicious. Prices are very reasonable for brunch or breakfast. As someone who is a Waffle House fanatic, this could replace it in my breakfast favorites category. I only wish they had bigger tables so we could have fit more food on ours!

There are no slot machines or anything to remind you of where you are, just a few banners from local sport teams. It's worth the drive to get away from the mayhem.

3ogfXs7PUO1m0chACioGrQ.text: This is a little breakfast joint off the strip in Las Vegas. The wait times are a little long on weekends but nothing out of the ordinary. They offer a selection of breakfast food that is pretty typical, eggs, bacon, burritos, pancakes etc. The food is not bad but its nothing special and the prices are kinda high. The first time I went it was pretty good, the second I was more disappointed. I ordered home fries and received what looked like pre frozen cubes of potato with no seasoning or flavor. Overall its so so, I doubt I will be coming back as I have found other places in Vegas with better food and cheaper prices. I have not tried lunch here so I do not know if its better.

ijx49pCxmrRMn-Xz9crfQA.text: This was our first time to Mr. Mamas and it won't be our last. Let's start with the staff. Beyond some of the beat service we have ever had in Las Vegas. The owner him self comes outs to see how you're doing and we saw our waitress more than any we have been served by. Now the food. OMG!! Delicious doesn't even begin to describe how wonderful ur breakfast was. I had to look to see if my mom was in the kitchen, it was THAT GOOD!!! Portions were great, cooked exactly the way we asked for it and we got it fast. I can't wait to try their lunch next time. Oh, the pancakes were as big your head! So good and fluffy. Go early because it fills up quickly. I wouldn't be surprised if they get. Line out the door.

VrujjHP0YYRLb4zWBOkRXw.text: If you are looking for a good breakfast, this is the place. It is nice that it is off the strip. Come hungry, lots of food! The staff is really friendly and very accommodating. Our waitress was honest and very helpful. We will be coming back here every time we visit Vegas!!

vJzN7Kl8-haT6YYEDtXVYA.text: Exceptional customer service. My wife And were greeted at the door by the owner. We ordered pancakes, biscuits and gravy, and a breakfast burrito. The food was good. Great menu with plenty of options. Plenty of parking, popular location but not overly crowded.

zp0JiSAmLYPEEfaMkRXQ_w.text: The food was amazing and the service was great. A very friendly atmosphere, even the owner came out to say high. We are definitely coming back when we come back to Vegas!

8Fb7H_ft2K3J_DBiq99PMA.text: Once I walked in I was greeted by such friendly employees it felt more like family. I will definitely be back when I come visit Las Vegas again!

al-bg354x7FP2k5xAm7UFQ.text: Service here was fantastic. The manager and our server were very friendly. However, the food is very average, don't get too excited by all of the positive reviews.

7PeJT0sQlvAAittlYYKzeA.text: Delicious, super fast, reasonable prices, and friendly people too!?!  I'm not a big breakfast guy but this place is great.

Dpyg4aRf4EozudNKkl1KXQ.text: Great friendly place and the food is bomb. This place has the best food for the buck, better then anything on the strip, when I come in from Cali this is one of my first stop for breakfast, key tip is to get there early, they get busy

3c8rxodlbHXBm2q9b1gcKw.text: I was so excited to try Mr Mamas for a nice diner breakfast. I was totally craving one morning a Jersey-style diner experience. In terms of the food, Mr Mamas fits the bill - no frills, no nonsense, down-to-earth breakfast comfort food. Pancakes were huuuuuuge, fluffy and yummy. Seriously, no complaints about the food here.  I was, however, disappointed with the service, which I expected to be spectacular given all the prior raving reviews. We were seated right away, but then basically ignored for the next 10-16 minutes. Ten minutes passed, and we attempted (and succeeded on our third try) to wave down a waiter. We asked if we could order since no one has come by our table yet. His asked us who our waiter was, which from our perspective was an odd thing to ask because had we known that, we wouldn't have stopped him. We said that we didn't know since literally no one has come by to greet us, or give us water or take a drink order. "Well I don't know who is taking care of your table today, you need to ask the person who is responsible for your table" was his answer before he walked off. I get it, he was a young server and maybe did not know any better, but then we tried waving down someone else and 2-3 times we were either rebuffed or outrightly ignored. My mother commented that she saw someone by the cashier acknowledge her (a manager, perhaps?) by nodding and waving in her direction that he would get to her shortly, but another 10 minutes passed and he never did.   Our waitress finally came around the 20-minute mark, but the damage was done. My parents, who rarely dined out, felt ignored and unhappy with the experience. My hubby, who needed to be back on the Strip within a certain time for business, asked the waitress typically how long it takes for food to get out. Her answer was that she "didn't know" - apparently a popular refrain. Just because a place in Vegas serves and looks like a Jersey diner, doesn't mean it operates with the efficiency of a Jersey diner - lesson learned for this naive tourist.  I wouldn't mind coming back here again and giving it another shot, but doubt i will return since my family was unhappy with the treatment. Unfortunate, because the food was very decent and prices fair.

Vh1Y2OsMbFx3yAkTJfNAXg.text: I finally tried Mr. Mamas.  It's the #2 restaurant in Vegas on TripAdvisor (as of the writing of this review).  The most outstanding thing is the number of hardworking people in this restaurant, a large number of workers who are all busy.  Second, everyone is incredibly friendly, and you probably won't get in or out of the restaurant without a very cheery welcome and thank you.  The service is spectacular.  The food: pretty standard breakfast fare -- no exotic options here.  I went with chicken fried steak.  The steak seemed a little pre-fab (my only complaint) but was very well seasoned (thank you!). And the gravy was excellent.  Homemade and tasty (I had been to another restaurant in the previous week that had average gravy and was disappointed).

FufpeDtB2YyUzuIHVYZFmQ.text: Soooooo good. Had pancakes and sausage. And a biscuit and gravy on the side. Both were phenomenal.

zWhlssJDGrqSWMNLt-nl1g.text: My toast showed up burnt, my steak that I ordered with my steak and eggs showed up well done when I ordered it medium rare.  I understand that it's tough for a short order cook to cook a perfect medium rare but this had exactly zero pink in it.  The home fries tasted like they came out of a bag.  Bummer.    The good is that the owner introduced himself when we entered and was very friendly.  Our waitress was very nice too.  My eggs were cooked properly which can be tough when you order over medium.   Problem is, I care way more about the quality of the food than the niceness of my waitress, so I probably won't be back.

1iR9uLms3lScxG0ml5H3ZA.text: From the moment  you walk in, til the time you leave, you're treated like family. The food is wonderful and they give you plenty of it. There is no reason to leave there not stuff (unless you have great control).  If there's a wait, it's well worth it. Can't say enough good things about this place.
